medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presents with 3 days of abdominal pain that began with an acute onset of malaise, fevers, and chills. Initially, the pain was vague and located mid-abdomen but migrated to the right lower quadrant (RLQ) and intensified in the past day. Fevers and chills resolved 2 days prior without intervention, but the pain persisted and worsened. Associated symptoms include nausea and a decrease in appetite; there was no vomiting. The patient has been passing flatus and experienced normal bowel movements, most recently 2 days ago.
